Tumor region annotation using reference (normal) cells

Source: R/run_highSpaClone.R
FindTumor.Rd

Tumor region annotation using reference (normal) cells

Usage

FindTumor(
  obj,
  ref,
  lambda = 1/1000,
  K = 2,
  max_iter = 500,
  min_iter = 30,
  epsilon = 5e-04,
  seed = 12345678
)

Arguments

obj

A highSpaClone object

ref

Character vector of reference (normal) cell-type labels matching obj@annotation$cell.label.

lambda

Numeric; spatial regularization strength passed to run_iter().

K

K=2.

max_iter

Integer; maximum number of outer iterations.

min_iter

Integer; minimum number of iterations before allowing early stop.

epsilon

Numeric; convergence threshold on relative objective change.

seed

Integer; random seed used in k-means initialization/updates.

Value

The input obj with updated fields:

  • obj@cnv.data: optimized CNV matrix (cells × bins).

  • obj@cluster: data.frame(cell.id, x, y, cell.label) with cell.label ∈ "Tumor", "Other".

Convergence and stopping

Early stop if relative change < epsilon after min_iter, or if the objective increases. If max_iter is reached without meeting the criterion, a message is printed.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
obj <- FindTumor(
  obj,
  ref = c("B cells", "T cells"),
  lambda = 1/1000,
  K = 2,
  max_iter = 300,
  min_iter = 30
)
head(obj@cluster)
} # }
